Key Match Events: Nikola Jokic dropped 37 points, 18 rebounds, and 15 assists on the Dallas Mavericks in a thrilling Sunday night win.
Pre-Game Insights: Michael Malone joked that he hoped Jokic would 'probably be fifth in MVP voting.'
Post-Match Reflections: Michael Malone said it's easy to see why the absurd NBA MVP ladder that put Anthony Davis and Jayson Tatum over Jokic in this year's early MVP conversation reek of 'voter fatigue.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jokic is averaging an astonishing 29.7 points, 13.7 rebounds, 11.7 assists, 1.7 steals, and one block per game while also enjoying an efficient true shooting percentage of 67.1.
Others: The Denver Nuggets have a sharp 7-3 record, and Jokic is past the point of caring about chasing regular-season MVPs, focusing on winning championships first and foremost.
